thread.title: Crowds protest Trump's travel ban at Pittsburgh International Airport
thread.title_full: Crowds protest Trump's travel ban at Pittsburgh International Airport

author: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Crowds protest Trump's travel ban at Pittsburgh International Airport
text:
Crowds protest Trump's travel ban at Pittsburgh International Airport January 29, 2017 4:45 PM Stephanie Strasburg/Post-Gazette People protest President Donald Trump's travel ban at the baggage claim area at Pittsburgh International Airport in Moon on Sunday. Stephanie Strasburg/Post-Gazette People chant "No hate, no fear. Everyone is welcome here" as they protest President Donald Trump's refugee ban at the arrival gate at Pittsburgh International Airport in Moon on Sunday. Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
As protests continue at airports across the country, people took to Pittsburgh International Airport on Sunday to reject President Donald Trump’s executive order on immigration barring immigrants from seven countries from entering the United States. 
Crowds rallied near baggage claim, as well as in other parts of the airport, holding signs and chanting phrases like, “No hate, no fear. Yinz are welcome here.” Mayor Bill Peduto also showed his support with a speech about some of Pittsburgh’s immigrants. People gather near baggage claim at Pittsburgh International Airport to protest President Donald Trump's travel ban. (Stephanie Strasburg/Post-Gazette) 
The order, which went into effect Saturday for people coming into the U.S. from Iran, Iraq, Syria, Sudan, Yemen, Libya and Somalia, led to travelers being detained at airports throughout the country. Mayor @billpeduto 's speech on PGH's immigrant stories spurs "No hate, no fear, yinz are welcome here" chant at #NoBanNoWall rally at airport pic.twitter.com/HYO3fYd2Xs
